1. Verification Process Over Text: Although universities sometimes send notifications, be cautious if a text message asks you to click on a link and enter credentials‚Äîeven if the message appears to be from your institution.

2. Domain Inconsistency: The provided link (https://verify-student-info.com/login) does not match the university‚Äôs official domain (typically something like ivybridge.edu). Always check that web addresses align with known official domains.

3. Urgency and Threats: Messages that impose a strict deadline and mention immediate consequences (e.g., suspension of services) can be tactics used in phishing schemes.

What You Should Do:

‚Ä¢ Verify Through Official Channels:  
‚ÄÉ‚Äì Visit your university‚Äôs official website (manually entering the address you know to be correct) and look for any notices about security updates.

‚Ä¢ Check With Campus Authorities: Reach out by phone or email (using contact details from previous legitimate communications or the official university website) to confirm whether this security update request is authentic.

‚Ä¢ Do Not Provide Sensitive Information: Until you‚Äôre certain you‚Äôre interacting with the genuine university system, avoid entering any personal details or logging in from unfamiliar links.

By taking these steps, you‚Äôll reduce the risk of falling prey to phishing scams or fraudulent activity while ensuring that any necessary updates to your student profile are completed safely. Stay cautious and verify any unexpected or urgent communications before taking action.
